metadata.title: CVE-2017-6960 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in apng2gif 1.7. There is an integer overflowresulting in a heap-based buffer over-read, related to the load_apngfunction and the imagesize variable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6960` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apng2gif - 1.8-0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apng2gif package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.8-0.1').
